packageMeta.name: purescript-pux
packageMeta.description: Build type-safe web apps with PureScript.

declarations.comments:
Create an application, which exposes a markup signal that can be used by
renderers.

```purescript
main = do
  app <- start
   { initialState
   , view
   , foldp
   , inputs: [] }

  renderToDOM "#app" app.markup app.input
```
declarations.title: start

declarations.comments:
The configuration of an app consists of foldp and view functions along
with an initial state. The `foldp` and `view` functions describe how to
step the state and view | the state.

The `inputs` array is for any external inputs you might need. These will
be merged into the app's input signal.
declarations.title: Config

declarations.comments:
The set of effects every Pux app needs to allow through when using `start`.
Extend this type with your own app's effects, for example:

```purescript
type AppEffects = (console :: CONSOLE, dom :: DOM)

main :: State -> Eff (CoreEffects AppEffects) (App DOMEvent State Event)
main state = do
  -- ...
```
declarations.title: CoreEffects

declarations.comments:
An `App` is a record consisting of:

* `markup` – A signal of `Markup e` representing the current view of the
  app. This is consumed by renderers.

* `state` – A signal representing the application's current state.

* `input` – A channel representing the application's event input.
declarations.title: App

declarations.comments: Return an `EffModel` from the current event and state.
declarations.title: FoldP

declarations.comments:
`EffModel` is a container for state and asynchronous effects which return
an event.
declarations.title: EffModel

declarations.comments: Create an `EffModel` with no effects from a given state.
declarations.title: noEffects

declarations.comments: Map over the state of an `EffModel`.
declarations.title: mapState

declarations.comments: Map over the effects of an `EffModel`.
declarations.title: mapEffects

declarations.comments: Wait for a specific event until returning the app state.
declarations.title: waitEvent

declarations.comments: Wait for a specific state before returning the app state.
declarations.title: waitState

declarations.comments:
Synonym for
[DOM.Event.Types.Event](https://pursuit.purescript.org/packages/purescript-dom/4.3.1/docs/DOM.Event.Types#t:Event)
to distinguish from application events.
declarations.title: DOMEvent

declarations.comments: Return `event.target.value` if it exists, or an empty string if not.
declarations.title: targetValue

declarations.comments:
A type for HTML markup, parametized by the events it may trigger. It is a
synonym for the `Markup` monad from
[purescript-smolder](https://pursuit.purescript.org/packages/purescript-smolder).
declarations.title: HTML

declarations.comments:
Memoize child view and map event handlers with parent event type.

It's important that `child` is only used at a top-level declaration and
not inside a view. This is because PureScript is eagerly evaluated like
JavaScript. If `child` is used inside a view it will recreate the memoized
function every time the view is called.
declarations.title: child

declarations.comments:
Map HTML with event type `a` to HTML with event type `b`.

It's important that `memoize` is only used at a top-level declaration –
not inside a view. This is because PureScript is eagerly evaluated like
JavaScript. If `memoize` is used inside a view it will recreate the memoized
function every time the view is called.
declarations.title: mapEvent

declarations.comments:
Memoize view. Uses JavaScript equality to match states.

It's important that `memoize` is only used at a top-level declaration and
not inside a view. This is because PureScript is eagerly evaluated like
JavaScript. If `memoize` is used inside a view it will recreate the memoized
function every time the view is called.
declarations.title: memoize

declarations.comments: Render CSS stylesheet and return a style element.
declarations.title: style

declarations.comments: An attribute prefixed with "data-".
declarations.title: data_

declarations.comments:
Control cursor focus declaratively. Whichever element has this attribute
will be focused after rendering if it was not already focused.
declarations.title: focused

declarations.comments:
Key attribute for improved rendering performance.
See: https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/lists-and-keys.html
declarations.title: key

declarations.comments: Render inline CSS and return a style attribute.
declarations.title: style

declarations.comments:
Returns a signal containing the current window.location pathname and search query,
which is updated on every "popstate" event.
declarations.title: sampleURL

declarations.comments:
```purescript
main = do
 app <- start
   { initialState
   , view
   , foldp
   , inputs: [] }

 renderToDOM "#app" app.markup app.input
```
declarations.title: renderToDOM

declarations.comments:
Return an HTML string from a component's HTML signal. The HTML returned
includes React-specific attributes for fast mounting in the browser.
declarations.title: renderToString

declarations.comments:
Return an HTML string from a component's HTML signal. The HTML returned is
stripped of all React-specific attributes.
declarations.title: renderToStaticMarkup

declarations.comments: Return a ReactClass from a component's HTML signal.
declarations.title: renderToReact

declarations.comments:
Create an HTML constructor for a React class using a unique name. When
rendered this element is replaced with the class.
declarations.title: reactClass

declarations.comments:
Create an HTML constructor for a React class using a unique name. When
rendered this element is replaced with the class. The returned constructor
takes an arbitrary props argument, which will be passed to the React class
when rendered.
declarations.title: reactClassWithProps
